commitMessage:
feat(toolchain): add regex extraction for structured validation results

## What Changed
- Added `error_pattern` and `warning_pattern` fields to tool-registry.yaml for all 7 tools (typescript, eslint, vitest, prettier, jscpd, dependency-cruiser, semgrep)
- Enhanced `ToolRegistryEntry` and `ToolCommand` interfaces with pattern fields
- Updated `RawToolResult` interface with structured extraction fields:
  - Added `exitCode`, `errorCount`, `warningCount` fields
  - Added `errors[]` and `warnings[]` string arrays
  - Removed deprecated `success` field (exit codes unreliable - dependency-cruiser uses non-zero for warnings)
- Modified ToolchainService to apply regex patterns and extract structured data
- Updated 5 test files to use `errorCount` instead of deprecated `success` field
- Fixed prettier error pattern to match only file paths, not success messages
- Fixed dependency-cruiser config to exclude data files (.yaml, .json, .md)
- Updated toolchain execution commands for safer error handling (|| true for tools with non-zero warning exits)
- Cleaned up 2 backup files (pm-hooks.original.bak, structure-generator.ts.bak)

## Why This Change
This infrastructure enables the parent feature (HODGE-359) to replace verbose quality-checks.md with token-efficient validation-results.json. By extracting structured error/warning data via regex patterns, AI can make quality gate decisions without parsing full tool output, reducing token usage by ~70-80%.

Since Hodge controls tool output formats via toolchain.yaml configuration (compact formats, no ANSI codes), regex patterns can be simple and reliable rather than handling arbitrary format variations.

## Impact
- Token efficiency: Structured counts and arrays replace verbose markdown reports
- Dynamic quality gates: All 7 configured tools have extraction patterns from day one
- Reliable validation: Error counts provide source of truth (not unreliable exit codes)
- Maintainable: Patterns centralized in tool-registry.yaml with clear tool-specific comments
- Testable: Uses mocked stdout strings respecting subprocess/toolchain execution bans (HODGE-317.1, HODGE-357.1)
- Production ready: All 1340 tests passing, all quality gates passing

ðŸ¤– Generated with [Claude Code](https://claude.com/claude-code)

Co-Authored-By: Claude <noreply@anthropic.com>
